alert.note: Alert for Central Colorado River Basin; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 5:09PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pitkin County through 545 PM MDT... At 507 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Marble, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. Heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Rockslides along highway 133 are possible. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Pitkin County, including the following locations... Redstone. This includes Colorado 133 between mile markers 41 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Grand Junction.

area.areaDesc: Central Colorado River Basin; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains
